isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 5000, 9100, 9200, 9400, AND 9900 MODELS - CAB ACCESSORIES - OPERATION - Electric Window - Right

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to ELECTRIC WINDOW - RIGHT circuit diagram in CTS-5119W or CTS-5273W. The right side electric window is controlled by the driver's right side window switch. To operate the window, the key must be in the on or accessory position. The circuit includes the electric window relay (145), window switch (439) and the right window motor. Power to the window switch is supplied from the B1 battery stud to the common terminal (30) of the window relay (145). With the key in the on or accessory position, the relay is energized applying power to terminal 4 (and internally to terminal 3) at the electric window switch (439). Note that switch terminals 4 and 3 are at 12V with key on and terminals 1 and 6 are always at ground.

svcsubproc.title: Window Down Operation
svcsubproc.para: With the window switch in the down position, power from switch terminal 5 is applied to the motor on circuit 83D. Circuit 83C from the motor to the switch terminal 2 becomes the ground circuit. With the switch in the down position, switch terminals 2 and 1 are connected, completing the path to ground.

svcsubproc.title: Window Up Operation
svcsubproc.para: With the window switch in the up position, power from switch terminal 2 is applied to the motor on circuit 83C. Circuit 83D from the motor to the switch terminal 5 becomes the ground circuit. With the switch in the up position, switch terminals 5 and 6 are connected, completing the path to ground.
